Class LongRangedWeapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
      • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.WeaponItem
        • game.LongRangedWeapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Weapon, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ItemInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Shotgun, SniperRifle

    public abstract class LongRangedWeapon
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.WeaponItem
    A base class for long-ranged weapons.
    Author:
    Tan Wei Li

    • Constructor Detail

      • LongRangedWeapon

        public LongRangedWeapon(java.lang.String name,
                        char displayChar,
                        int damage,
                        java.lang.String verb)
        Constructor. Create a WeaponItem with capability of LONG_RANGED_WEAPON.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the item
        displayChar - character to use for display when item is on the ground
        damage - amount of damage this weapon does
        verb - verb to use for this weapon, e.g. "shoots"

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        public java.lang.String shoot()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Shoot using the long-ranged weapon and return a string reporting the number of bullets left. Use one bullet in the ammunition box of the long-ranged weapon
        Returns:
        a string reporting number of bullet left after using one bullet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the ammunition box is empty.

      • refillAmmunitionBox

        public void refillAmmunitionBox()
        Refill the ammunitionBox of the long-ranged weapon. Assign a new AmmunitionBox instance to the ammunitionBox attribute of the long-ranged weapon.

      • hasBullet

        public java.lang.Boolean hasBullet()
        Check if the long-ranged weapon has bullets left to use.
        Returns:
        true if there is bullet left in ammunition box of the long-ranged weapon and false otherwise.

      • getAllowableActions

        public java.util.List<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action> getAllowableActions(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor actor,
                                                                            edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
        If the Player has a shotgun without bullet in his inventory and has at least one ammunition in his inventory, return a list consisting of RefillBulletAction.
        Parameters:
        actor - actor that we're interested in, i.e. owner of the list of possible actions
        map - game map the actor is currently on
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of Action
